personal_info.name: Chinmaya Joshi
personal_info.about: A creative data scientist with a passion for uncovering stories hidden within data and building intelligent systems.

about_me.title: My Philosophy
description: I believe that data is the new clay. It's a raw, often messy, material that holds the potential for immense beauty and utility. My approach is that of a sculptor: to meticulously clean, shape, and mold data until it reveals the insights and stories hidden within.

My work isn't just about models and metrics; it's about building intelligent systems that are not only accurate but also fair, interpretable, and robust. I thrive on the challenge of translating complex business problems into elegant, data-driven solutions.
Whether it's building a predictive engine or architecting a data pipeline, I'm driven by a relentless curiosity and a desire to create things that have a tangible impact.

education.institution: SRM Institute of Science and Technology
education.degree: B. Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering

certifications.name: SQL: A Step-by-Step Intorduction for Data Science
LLMs with Google Cloud and Python
Modern Computer Vision GPT, PyTorch, Keras, OpenCV

description: Developed, Deployed, and Maintained 3 NLP Production Tools for S&P 50 Client as Technical Lead
Managed a cross-function team of 5 (DS, DE, Cloud), optimizing workflows to double project delivery speed
Shipped ensemble GBM model to flag high-severity (outlier) error tickets, cutting budget costs by ~$500K
Fine-tuned models by training sBERT embeddings on customer domain data using transfer learning
Optimized domain-specific similarity classification models on 2M+ document pairs, boosting F1-score to 0.92
Drove 80% increase in tool adoption with TAM and User Penetration Analysis, A/B testing and SME feedback
Improved model robustness, reducing output variance by 30% & scaled inference load by 300% using MLOps
Conducted weekly client briefings to drive feature approvals and data expansion pipeline strategies
Worked on machine learning model deployment applied research using AWS EC2 and ElasticMapReduce (EMR)
Developed Hybrid RAG using Language Agent Tree Search (LATS) to Enhance Regulatory Decision-Making
Volunteer open-source project for Sri Lanka Tea Regulatory Industry
RAG Evaluation using LLM-as-a-judge with Gemini 1.5
Technologies: Python, Llama-Index, Agentic RAG, Groq API, Llama3-70b, KDBAI VectorDB, Streamlit Cloud
Classified Brain Scan sMRI Images for Early Detection and Diagnosis of Alzheimer’s Disease
Finetuned pre-trained CNNs like ResNet, MobileNet, EfficientNet using Transfer Learning
CNN Hyperparameter tuning using GridSearch for optimizing model performance

personal_projects.title: Finetuning LLM using QLoRA
description: Finetune LLM (SmolLM2-1.7B-Instruct) using 4bit QLoRA
Improved BoolQ Benchmark performance accuracy from 56% to 70.4% (increased of 23%)
Tracked tranining loss and saved checkpoints using WandB.

personal_projects.title: Sarcastic Headlines Classification with Model Interpretability
description: Classified Sarcastic Headlines with TFIDF using XGBoost
Trained and Tracked 50+ XGBoost models for Hyperparameter Finetuning over n_estimator, max_depth, vectorizer_length, subsample- optimizing for ROC Score
Model Interpretation Analysis with:
Feature Importance
Feature Permutation Importance
Local Interpretable Model-Agnostic Explanations (LIME)
SHapely Adaptive exPlanations (SHAP)

personal_projects.title: Chess AI Tutor Bot
description: Interactive Chess webapp (Flask) with LLM chatbot as a real-time tutor assistant.
Uses LLM tool-use with Stockfish chess engine.
Reasoning LLM Deepseek-R1-distill using Groq API.

personal_projects.title: Semantic Clustering of Constitution Articles
description: Semantic Clustering of Indian Constitution Articles using Text Preprocessing
Created OpenAI API to generate Semantic Embeddings for each Article
Used KMeans clustering on embeddings and used tSNE dimension reduction for visualization

personal_projects.title: Data Poisoning Attack on LLM RAG
description: Create a malicious prompt payload, used it to poison the RAG knowledge.
Used Prompt Injection and generated poisoned vector embedding.
Injected poisoned vector into the FAISS vector database.
Showcasd severe compromise in the RAG response authenticity.

personal_projects.title: Regression using MLFlow in Google Colab
description: Predicted concrete strength by training Linear Regression, Ridge Regression and Random Forrest Regressors
Used MLFlow in Google Colab by exposing tracking server with localtunnel for UI access

Comparing attack resilience for Llama-3-8b, LlamaGuard-3-8b, deepseek-r1-distill-llama-70b, and more

personal_projects.title: Automated Red Team Scan on News Summarization AI
description: Built News Keyword Extraction and Summarization Bot using LangChain with News Database and Prompt Engineering.
Assessed Robustness, Harmfulness and Misinformation risks using Giskard and LangChain
Identified Injection Vulnerabilities in Gemini 2.0 Flash.

personal_projects.title: Passkey Extraction using Prompt Injection
description: Explored Prompt Injection techniques to bypass guardrails of an LLM System Prompt via Token Manipulation
Manual Prompt Injection strategies Roleplay, l33tsp34k, Jailbreaks, and more.

blog_posts.title: State of LLM Vulnerabilities in 2025 (OWASP Top 10)
blog_posts.summary: Summarizes the OWASP Top 10 list for LLM security risks in 2025, detailing the most critical vulnerabilities such as prompt injection, sensitive information disclosure, supply chain attacks, and more, while also discussing examples and potential defenses for each.

blog_posts.title: Secret Language of LLMs- Hidden, Special, and Glitch Tokens
blog_posts.summary: Explains how LLMs use structural tokens like <pause> or <think> to scaffold reasoning, and explores “glitch tokens” (weird under‑trained tokens) that can trigger bizarre or vulnerable behaviors.

blog_posts.title: Story of Ilya Sutskever: before, during, and after co-founding OpenAI
blog_posts.summary: Traces Ilya Sutskever’s journey from early life and education to his pivotal role in AI breakthroughs and as a co-founder of OpenAI, highlighting his influence on the organization’s success and the vision for open, non-profit AI development.

blog_posts.title: Digital and Biological Paths to Intelligence - What really led to Geoff Hinton leaving Google
blog_posts.summary: Explores Geoff Hinton’s shift in perspective about AI dangers, explaining how his research led him to conclude that digital learning algorithms (like backpropagation) may surpass biological ones, prompting his public warnings about AI risks after leaving Google.
